column4: i have a MAXTOR model 6Y060L0 (60G) hard drive that is recognized by BIOS (it's in the boot order map) and is recognized by the ubuntu after boot but not seen by grub.  The command "geometery (hd1)" returns with a no drive found error... Any clues?
..after boot, I can even mount the (hd1,0) partition (hdb1) to a mount point, /mnt/test, and see all the windows files
so you do get the grub menu at boot (If you single boot, hold SHIFT at boot)
the geometry command doesn't see the drive and the windows boot (chainloader) command doesn't find the drive
so, I am able to look at thinks with the grub cli
if you use a chroot from a liveCD, you can upgrade the OS and reinstall Grub to the MBR
grub is working just dandy... It sits on (hd0) and runs the show fine.  Where would I reinstall grub to?
you'd put it in the MBR, the chroot will allow you to run updates and the newer grub may fly better
it's on the MBR of hd0 already
It is a pretty ancient version of Grub... wish me luck as I upgrade
yay.... I'm now running grub2... booo... it still can't see the Maxtor drive... (the drive is fine and seen AFTER boot however!)
no  it's an old ATA IDE drive
I may just end up cloning the drive to a 'newer' one and seeing if grub can handle it better.
